title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
We have an iMac Pro 27" 2017 here that someone has tried to repair but in taking the logicboard out have pulled a component off. The original fault was that it wasn't booting, which I suspect is a problem with the T2 but they decided to replace the power board and hence damaged the board.

Can any identify what this component is and would it be detrimental to it starting.

iFixit mentioned AQUANTIA AQtion [URL='https://www.aquantia.com/products/client-connectivity/aqtion-aqc107/'][U]AQC107-B1-C[/U][/URL] PCIe to multi-gigabit ethernet controller so i'm thinking it's a filter and wouldn't stop the iMac from starting.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
LAN controller shouldn't be a problem for starting.
However, be sure no short to ground from the pads of broken coil.

Do you get any voltage on the board now?

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
No short to ground on the broken coil.

At the moment I have 12v coming from the power board (4 screw terminals light the Apple dustbin), no lights on the diag but if I press the reset button (like on the A1534, A1932) and keep it pressed I get one light. Once I let go the light goes off. 3.3v at the power button but shorting the connector doesn't change anything.

I can't find any schematics on this and not sure if there's anything similar that I can use as this iMac is completely different to any of the others that I have worked on.

Have you working on this model? Any suggestions?

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
I saw the boardview on XinZhiZao server.
Schematic is available on Internet.

Can you put the machine in DFU mode?

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
I hear a lot about XinZhiZao server but I've never been able to find it. Do you have to pay? is there a direct link?

So I've learnt something new about the iMac Pro. The button under the diagnostic lights is used to display the lights when pressed. This was showing 1 light and after using configurator to revive the iMac Pro it's started working again. 

I'm going to have to leave the coil as it is for now as I don't know what the value is until I get hold of the schematics.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
You can replace with tiny wire jumpers.
XinZhiZao 1 year subscription is available for aprox US50$; not too much for the information they have.
I didn't see 00967 boardview in other place.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://global.wmdang.com/index/login/login[/URL]

However, the schematic is available on Internet.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FAMIYMC7KP2nM8HrQekZr8NgyYYs350Q/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: Thanks... I will look at XinZhiZao. My firewall won't allow it and that's why I couldn't find any info on it.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: PP12V_S0_CPUCORE_FLT 12v on  side 1 (r9003) side 2 REG_CPU_VINSNS 0v u9000 dead? replace?

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
Very likely.

What is resistance to ground on pin 2?

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
I already replaced U9000 but now I don’t have 12v on pin 1 
Pin 1 400
Pin 2 500

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
Ooops, I jsut saw R9003 is 100K; so no reason to get burnt.
It is not a series resistor on the power rail.

Check L9090...

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
L9090 0v 400
And there is now just one light..

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: Q1030 PP12VR11V_G3H_RSNS 12v and PP12v_MAIN 0v and the voltage climb very very slowly

title: 820-00967 component identify

message:

up to 3v not more then that..

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
"L9090 0v 400"
Did you check its continuity?

Check what happens when you've changed U9000; broken trace, bad solders, knocked off component.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
PP12v_MAIN 0v on Q1030 continue to L9090 and continue to PP12V_S0_CPUCORE_FLT_REG..
from were i get the  PP12v_MAIN and PP12v_s0? i do get 12V on PP12VR11V_3GH
i was put few time the U9000 but the same, and no short or missing/broken component...wierd!

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: i dont get 12v like before on (r9003) PP12V_S0_CPUCORE_FLT 12v  side 1  so its not from U9000.. should i need to fix the 12v first right?

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
PP12V_MAIN comes from PP12V_ACDC power rail (RI010).
Check diode mode to ground at PP12V_MAIN first.

PP12VR11V_3GH  comes from PP11V_ACDC.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
o.k!! i didnt know that the 4 screws on the power supply are important for this!
so now i have again 12v on side 1 of r9003 but i have 0v on side 2   (REG_CPU_VINSNS) 500 on diode mode.
and still just on light...restore not do nothing...just stuck.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: r9003 is 100k out of the board but its show 2k on the board

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
Big value resistor shows lower value measured on board; depending on other components (resistors, chips) connected in same points.

Do not expect 12v after R9003; calculate R9003/4 divider, to find its output voltage.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: How do I calculate that? And what is the next step?

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
Calculated voltage is 0.177V aprox.

What happened on the MLB?
You had two lights, before touching U9000.
Re-check what you did there.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: i will check again...LED #2 is CORE_VOLTAGES_ON. PP3V3_S0 0V - 180

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: i can find the problem..U9000 look fine..i dont know what to check around, and i prefer to go step by step to see exactly from where is the problem.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: I can’t *

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: Be sure all ZTI0xx points are connected to the power supply.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message: o.k i was put back the "old" u9000 now it pass DFU there is just 2# light, the 3# light is the memory sticks? or something else ?

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
Yes, it should light before the GPU LED.
If S0 LED is on, there must be several coils with voltage, including the one for RAM; check that.

title: 820-00967 component identify
message:
O.k it was also problem with one of the memory stick..
Now everything work.!
So for other that will fix this shi** few things.
All the 4 power supply screws(silver) must be connected to get 12v on board.
After replace/upgrade something and you see one led on, just do restore with DFU.
1# led is mean that the board is getting voltage.
2# turn on just after restore if you replace something.
3# just when the iMac is on and getting the gpu work.
Hope it will work for other!
And be careful when you take the board off, you can broke some components off🤷🏻
Thanks
